original_solution_mapping.L1: He drives each vehicle 150 miles because 450 / 3 = <<450/3=150>>150
original_solution_mapping.L2: The first car will need 3 gallons of gas because 150 / 50 = <<150/50=3>>3
original_solution_mapping.L3: The second car will need 15 gallons of gas because 150 / 10 = <<150/10=15>>15
original_solution_mapping.L4: The third car will need 10 gallons of gas because 150 / 15 = <<150/15=10>>10

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 5862.
    Returns: the total cost of gas each month.
    """
    # L1
    total_monthly_mileage = 450 # 450-mile monthly driving mileage
    num_cars = 3 # three cars
    mileage_per_car = total_monthly_mileage / num_cars

    # L2
    mpg_car1 = 50 # first car averages 50 miles per gallon
    gallons_car1 = mileage_per_car / mpg_car1

    # L3
    mpg_car2 = 10 # second car averages 10 miles per gallon
    gallons_car2 = mileage_per_car / mpg_car2

    # L4
    mpg_car3 = 15 # third car averages 15 miles per gallon
    gallons_car3 = mileage_per_car / mpg_car3

    # L5
    total_gallons = gallons_car1 + gallons_car2 + gallons_car3

    # L6
    cost_per_gallon = 2 # gas costs $2 per gallon
    total_cost = total_gallons * cost_per_gallon

    # FA
    answer = total_cost
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: He drives each vehicle {mileage_per_car} miles because {total_monthly_mileage} / {num_cars} = <<{total_monthly_mileage}/{num_cars}={mileage_per_car}>>{mileage_per_car}
The first car will need {gallons_car1} gallons of gas because {mileage_per_car} / {mpg_car1} = <<{mileage_per_car}/{mpg_car1}={gallons_car1}>>{gallons_car1}
The second car will need {gallons_car2} gallons of gas because {mileage_per_car} / {mpg_car2} = <<{mileage_per_car}/{mpg_car2}={gallons_car2}>>{gallons_car2}
The third car will need {gallons_car3} gallons of gas because {mileage_per_car} / {mpg_car3} = <<{mileage_per_car}/{mpg_car3}={gallons_car3}>>{gallons_car3}
He will need {total_gallons} gallons in total because {gallons_car1} + {gallons_car2} + {gallons_car3} = <<{gallons_car1}+{gallons_car2}+{gallons_car3}={total_gallons}>>{total_gallons}
This will cost him ${total_cost} because {total_gallons} x ${cost_per_gallon} = $<<{total_gallons}*{cost_per_gallon}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}
